alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hot Springs, east central Fremont and central Washakie Counties through 100 AM MDT... At 1214 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Thermopolis, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Thermopolis and Hot Springs State Park around 1230 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lucerne, Kirby and Winchester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
